intro: Coussarea boliviensis, commonly known as the Bolivian coussarea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are typically elliptical with a smooth surface and a glossy appearance. Coussarea boliviensis is often found in humid, shaded environments within montane forests.
